body: I'm not sure what API aliyun uses. It looks like it might be s3 compatible - the docs aren't clear.  Try using `rclone config` with the s3 module - does that work?
I think it should be necessary to write a .go file，I'm trying edit it.
Make sure you read the [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) file, in particular the sections on making a new remote!  Good luck and let me know if you need help.

Hi,I met some problems.If I copy a file between bucket in the same region,it can't work，There is an error like this：

```
    C:\rclone>rclone copy oss:nishinamemei/notes.txt oss:luolibin321
    bucket:  nishinamemei
    directory:  notes.txt
    path:  nishinamemei/notes.txt
    endpoint:  xxxxxxx
    accessID: xxxxx
    accessKey:  xxxxx
    bucket:  luolibin321
    directory:
    path:  luolibin321
    endpoint:  oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com
    accessID:  LTAIGvAl2UDOCPha
    accessKey:  FVZ0UOkBaXPhMDb2lqvhX6DdpiIaa0
    panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
    [signal 0xc0000005 code=0x0 addr=0x58 pc=0x72ad68]

goroutine 46 [running]:
github.com/ncw/rclone/fs.Copy(0x138b380, 0xc04227e100, 0x0, 0x0, 0xc0422787a6, 0x9, 0x138b400, 0xc04227e600, 0x0, 0x0)
        C:/GOPATH/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/fs/operations.go:350 +0x998
github.com/ncw/rclone/fs.(*syncCopyMove).pairCopyOrMove(0xc0422be000, 0xc042268d80, 0x138b380, 0xc04227e100, 0xc0422be0d0)
        C:/GOPATH/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/fs/sync.go:377 +0x33b
created by github.com/ncw/rclone/fs.(*syncCopyMove).startTransfers
        C:/GOPATH/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/fs/sync.go:406 +0xa6

```
If I copy a file between bucket in the different region,it can copy the file ,but the contents of the document changed,and the size changed.The following is the contents of the file （Inside is the source bucket information）：

```
 <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ListBucketResult>
  <Name>nishinamemei</Name>
  <Prefix></Prefix>
  <Marker></Marker>
  <MaxKeys>100</MaxKeys>

<Key>hi/</Key>
<LastModified>2017-09-19T07:13:09.000Z</LastModified>
<ETag>"D41D8CD98F00B204E9800998ECF8427E"</ETag>
<Type>Normal</Type>
<Size>0</Size>
<StorageClass>Standard</StorageClass>

  <DisplayName>1118094827356724</DisplayName>
</Owner>
  </Contents>
  <Contents>
<Key>notes.txt</Key>
<LastModified>2017-09-22T06:29:49.000Z</LastModified>
<ETag>"71057C4CB0A4227C912ED0FBE73877F5"</ETag>
<Type>Normal</Type>
<Size>1492</Size>
<StorageClass>Standard</StorageClass>
<Owner>
  <ID>1118094827356724</ID>
  <DisplayName>1118094827356724</DisplayName>
</Owner>
  </Contents>
</ListBucketResult>

```
I do not know which method may be a problem，Can you give me some suggestions？
@ @ncw I really need your help....Thank you very much.

@luolibin are you using the s3 remote code unmodified?  If not can you link to the source please?

Assuming you are using v1.37 then the traceback is at this line

```go
		err = errors.Errorf("corrupted on transfer: sizes differ %d vs %d", src.Size(), dst.Size())
```

Which would mean, most likely, that `dst` is `nil`.  Which most likely means that the `Copy` method in the fs returned a `nil` object without returning an error.

That is guesswork though, so if you could tell me what code (rclone version, or link to source) you are running that would help!

Thanks

I was written according to oss-sdk，The rclone version is 1.37.
I can successfully use mkdir, rmdir, ls, lsd, size and other methods, and I can copy the local file upload to the cloud disk (although successful, but also read metadata fail and set modification time fail), but the copy method has a problem. I realized that you said the problem, I guess it will not be a problem with the readMetaData method in the .go file.
My English is not very good, may be a bit difficult to read, I hope you can understand .....
@ncw I guess it  may be a problem with the readMetaData method in the .go file.I don't know if my guess is wrong.

I will sign up for an aliyun account and see if I can replicate the problem

This might be a place where Aliyun deviates slightly from AWS - hopefully we can find a work-around.
The problem has been solved，Thank you！

@luolibin I have finally managed to set up an Aliyun account so I'm ready to help now. Do you have some code to share? I haven't managed to make rclone work at all using the s3 interface - I keep getting ``` AccessDenied Anonymous access is forbidden for this operation. 59E23342EABE051B37BDFA3F oss-eu-central-1.aliyuncs.com ``` Which I don't understand as I'm sending an Authorization: header.

@ncw 
Because the reasons for the time difference, so long to reply to you, I am sorry.
I was the first time to use golang, so the code is written messy, but now almost all functions can be achieved, but can not operate the bucket the folder directory inside the bucket.
Aliyun's sdk address: [https://github.com/aliyun/aliyun-oss-go-sdk/tree/master/oss]
Here is my code.
[oss.txt](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/1385116/oss.txt)
And the Copy method in oss.go not executed when I copy something，and it can succeed.

@ncw
I made a new file，it can operate the  the folder directory inside the bucket if I comment out this code（Line 651 in operations.go）：
```
// check remote name belongs in this directry
		remote := entry.Remote()
		switch {
		case !ok:
		 ignore
		case !strings.HasPrefix(remote, prefix):
			ok = false
			Errorf(entry, "Entry doesn't belong in directory %q (too short) - ignoring", dir)
		case remote == prefix:
			ok = false
			Errorf(entry, "Entry doesn't belong in directory %q (same as directory) - ignoring", dir)
		case strings.ContainsRune(remote[len(prefix):], '/'):
			ok = false
			Errorf(entry, "Entry doesn't belong in directory %q (contains subdir) - ignoring", dir)
		default:
		 ok
		}

```
Whether this will affect the use of other cloud disk？
[oss.txt](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/1386870/oss.txt)
